We feel that sentences for violent crimes against the person are disproportionate to crimes concerning property or money, to the seriousness of the crime, and the long-lasting impact it has on victims.
Our Government is responsible for setting the tone of the judges’ guidelines formulated by the Sentencing Council.
We demand a Parliamentary debate on:
▪ Introducing new guidelines that allow more proportionate & balanced sentencing relative to the physical & emotional effects on the victim.
▪ Better and more proactive information for the victim from when the crime is reported, and active participation throughout the charging, court process & sentencing.
▪ The apparent ‘soft touch’ sentences for repeat violent offenders.
▪ Availability of Legal Aid; the mechanism by which the offender makes contribution to compensation to the victim (i.e. via the Compensation Board rather than to/via the court); and whether it should be payable over time (i.e. if the offender is on a low income).
